info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 13 at 9:35PM EDT until May 14 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
FFWLWX
The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Greene County in central Virginia...
* Until 1245 AM EDT.
* At 935 PM EDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in The Stanardsville, Ruckersville, and Dawsonville areas including the Highway 29 and 33 corridors. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1.5 to 2.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring.
This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for The Stanardsville, Ruckersville, and Dawsonville areas including the Highway 29 and 33 corridors. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW!
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Emergency management reported.
IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Stanardsville... Ruckersville... Lydia... Amicus... Mcmullen... Haneytown... Quinque... Saint George... Fletcher... Burtonville... Shady Grove... Newtown... Dawsonville... Mission Home...
This includes the following Flood Prone Roads... Mutton Hollow Road near Spotswood Trail, Carpenters Mill Road at Route 607, Advance Mills Road and and Route 617, Westview Road and Deep Step Drive, Seminole Trail at White Run near Route 645, Route 621 along South River near Madison Road, 3300 Block of Spotswood Trail, Garth Road near Swift Run, Dyke Road near Blue Run near Spotswood Trail, South River Road near The South River, Dundee Road at The South River, Middle River Road near The Conway River, Octonia Road at South River Road and Celt Road near Amicus Road.
info.instruction:
Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR THE STANARDSVILLE, RUCKERSVILLE, AND DAWSONVILLE AREAS INCLUDING THE HIGHWAY 29 AND 33 CORRIDORS
NWS: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY this area til 12:45 AM EDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY is in effect for this area until 12:45 AM EDT. This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR THE STANARDSVILLE, RUCKERSVILLE, AND DAWSONVILLE AREAS INCLUDING THE HIGHWAY 29 AND 33 CORRIDORS
SNM: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 12:45 AM EDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 12:45 AM EDT. Esta es una situacion extremadamente peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
